item.title: Capes Are Invisible :/ Halp Pl0x
item.dc:creator: @knightlord knightlord
item.description:
@knightlord wrote:

You need to set the priorities correct for your models. I had this problem too before with my skillcapes but I set the priorities, VSKIN, and TSKIN in a program called metasequoia.

Read full topic

item.title: Capes Are Invisible :/ Halp Pl0x
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

Hey guys, I have added Max & Completionistâ€™s cape to my PI server and client, Everything is fine generally except for this problem.

[center][/center]

Although the thing is that they look fine from this angle

[center][/center]

The ints for the capes are

case 1007: itemDef.modelid = 65262; itemDef.name = "Max Cape"; itemDef.description = "The cape for those who've achieved 99 in all stats."; itemDef.modelZoom = 1385; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 24; itemDef.modelRotationY = 279; itemDef.modelRotationX = 948; itemDef.anInt165 = 65300; //male wield model itemDef.anInt200 = 65322; //femArmModel itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; break; case 1019: itemDef.modelid = 65270; itemDef.name = "Completionist Cape"; itemDef.description = "A cape for true masters of the game"; itemDef.modelZoom = 1385; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 24; itemDef.modelRotationY = 279; itemDef.modelRotationX = 948; itemDef.anInt165 = 65297; //male wield model itemDef.anInt200 = 65297; //femArmModel itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; break;
